description: U.S. Ambassador to Canada Pete Hoekstra said Washington may need to reassess airport pre-clearance as part of an at-times animated exchange during a forum with Canadian business leaders in Banff, Alta., on Thursday.
title: U.S. ambassador says Washington has to 'take a look' at airport pre-clearance, citing drop in Canadian tourism

description: James Comey was charged Thursday with making a false statement and obstruction in a criminal case filed days after U.S. President Donald Trump appeared to urge his attorney general to prosecute the former FBI director and other perceived political enemies.
title: Former FBI director James Comey indicted on criminal charges

description: FIFA announced Thursday that Maple, a red-clad moose, will be Canada's official mascot for the 2026 World Cup. Zayu the Jaguar and Clutch the Bald Eagle will serve as mascots for fellow co-hosts Mexico and the United States, respectively.
title: Meet Maple the Moose, Canada's mascot for the FIFA 2026 World Cup

description: Canadians have mixed reactions in the wake of a federal government announcement that could change how many of them get their mail.
title: From pragmatism and concern to 'get over it,' Canadians react to changes to mail delivery

description: U.S. President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday declaring that his plan to sell TikTok's U.S. operations to U.S. and global investors will meet the requirements in a 2024 law that says the short video app will be banned unless its Chinese owners sell it.
title: Trump signs order saying China will sell TikTok assets, allowing app to keep operating in U.S.

description: The gunman who opened fire on an Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility in Dallas hated the U.S. government and wanted to incite terror by killing federal agents, officials said at a news conference Thursday, offering the first hint of a motive in the attack.
title: Man who shot at Texas ICE facility wanted to 'incite terror' and intended to kill ICE agents, officials say

description: Alberta's justice minister has been directed to introduce new legislation on Medical Assistance in Dying, or MAID, that would give the government greater control and oversight of the program.
title: Alberta justice minister told to legislate new safeguards, oversight of MAID

description: Vitalité Health Network says it will take action to prevent the kind of mistreatment of psychiatric patients that was detailed in an ombud report this week — treatment that one relative called 'inhumane' and 'heartbreaking.'
title: N.B. health authority apologizes over patients being assaulted, left soiled while in restraints

description: Premier Doug Ford says Ontario will “do whatever it takes" to ensure the remaining belugas at Marineland will get "the best life possible.” Ford spoke Thursday, two days after CBC confirmed the shuttered amusement park in Niagara Falls has applied to Ottawa to export the 30 whales.
title: Ford says Ontario will ensure remaining Marineland beluga whales will get 'the best life possible'

description: Canadian actor William Shatner cleared up his health status in an Instagram post on Thursday, telling fans that he was completely fine following reports he'd been rushed to hospital. He also had some sage advice to boot: "Don’t tr
title: William Shatner clarifies he's just fine, following reports of a medical emergency

description: Israel will reopen the only crossing between the Israeli-occupied West Bank and Jordan to passenger traffic only, starting Friday morning, the Israeli Airports Authority said on Thursday.
title: Israel to reopen West Bank crossing to Jordan to passenger traffic only

description: The federal government has quietly removed more counter-tariffs on American goods than initially advertised, according to an order-in-council published online.
title: Carney government quietly dropped more U.S. counter-tariffs than advertised

description: A Canadian independent human rights group has joined the growing calls to suspend Israeli soccer teams from international play over the war in Gaza.
title: Advocacy group calls on Canada Soccer to refuse to host World Cup if Israel plays

description: Amazon.com will pay $2.5 billion US in fines and payments to Prime subscribers to settle a U.S. Federal Trade Commission case alleging the retail juggernaut signed users up for the subscription without their consent, the FTC said on Thursday.
title: Amazon to pay $2.5B US for deceptive Prime subscription practices

description: An inmate who has pleaded guilty to murdering Robert Pickton in prison last year says he did it for the serial killer's victims.
title: 'I did it for the victims,' Robert Pickton's killer tells court during guilty plea

description: On Thursday morning, grief-stricken family, friends and community members gathered at a mosque in Brossard, Que., to pray and honour the memory of a 15-year-old boy who was shot and killed by Longueuil police Sunday.
title: Sorrow, prayer at funeral for 15-year-old killed by police in Longueuil, Que.
Putin is poking NATO with drones and jets. The military alliance is still sorting out its response

description: Canadians hoping to get their hands on treasures from Hudson's Bay won't have to wait much longer for the chance. An Ontario court has approved a November sale of 1,700 pieces of art and about 2,700 artifacts belonging to the fallen retailer.
title: Hudson's Bay gets court permission to auction off 'retail era' artifacts

description: Crown attorneys are reviewing assault charges laid by police against Jeremy David McDonald, the Lindsay, Ont., man accused of attacking a home invader after an overnight break-in last month. The development leaves a question mark over the case that set off a debate over self-defence inside a home.
title: Crown reviewing assault charges laid against Ontario man who fought intruder

description: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas addressed the United Nations General Assembly on Thursday, reiterating calls to put a permanent end to the nearly two-year-long war in Gaza, saying Israel has been conducting a "war of genocide, destruction, starvation and displacement," and Palestinians are determined to "not leave our homeland."
title: Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas reiterates calls for permanent end to war in Gaza

description: A man with a violent criminal history who escaped from a B.C. jail three years ago has been arrested in Qatar, according to RCMP.
title: B.C. fugitive Rabih Alkhalil arrested in Qatar after 3 years on the run: RCMP

description: Starbucks is laying off around 900 non-retail employees and closing some U.S. and Canadian stores as it focuses more of its resources on a turnaround.
title: Starbucks shuttering stores, laying off 900 workers in Canada and U.S.

description: A 47-year-old woman accused of throwing scalding water on a young child pleaded guilty to aggravated assault at the Longueuil Courthouse on Monday.
title: Quebec woman pleads guilty to aggravated assault for throwing scalding water on 10-year-old boy

description: The parliamentary budget officer says he expects the upcoming fall budget will reveal a sharp increase in Ottawa's annual deficit to $68.5 billion this year, up from $51.7 billion last year.
title: Federal budget watchdog forecasts sharp rise in deficit to $68.5B this year

description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford called the traffic enforcement tool a "cash grab" at a news conference in Vaughan Thursday. He said his government will introduce new legislation to ban speed cameras.
title: Ford government says it will ban speed cameras across Ontario

description: China has announced its first detailed target to cut carbon emissions. It was among the new climate plans and pledges from 100 other countries at a leaders' summit Wednesday during the United Nations General Assembly focused on cutting fossil fuel emissions.
title: China announces its 1st detailed goal to cut emissions

description: The U.S. government has endorsed an obscure drug as a potential treatment for autism symptoms that medical researchers say isn't backed by solid evidence.
title: What is leucovorin, the drug the Trump team touted at its autism announcement?

description: Israeli forces advanced deeper into Gaza City on Thursday as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu headed to New York to address the United Nations General Assembly, with U.S. President Donald Trump pursuing a deal to end the Gaza war.
title: Israel deepens Gaza City offensive as Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas set to address UN

description: European soccer body UEFA is moving toward a vote to suspend its member federation Israel over the war in Gaza, people familiar with the proposal told The Associated Press on Thursday.
title: European soccer body UEFA moves toward vote to suspend Israel

description: A Paris court sentenced former French president Nicolas Sarkozy to five years in prison on Thursday after finding him guilty on a key charge in his trial for alleged illegal campaign financing by the government of then-Libyan leader Moammar Gadhafi.
title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy sentenced to 5 years in prison in corruption case

description: One of the Blue Jays' worst skids of the season has come at a most inopportune time. A 7-1 loss to Boston on Wednesday night, coupled with the Yankees' 8-1 win over the Chicago White Sox, left Toronto and New York tied for first place in the American League East Division standings.
title: Blue Jays lose sole possession of AL East lead after loss to Red Sox, Yankees win

description: Denmark said Thursday that drone incursions that briefly shut two of its airports and affected military installations overnight were hybrid attacks intended to spread fear, but that officials did not know who was behind them.
title: Denmark flights again affected by drone incursions officials call 'systematic'

description: For three straight years, Alberta has been the most popular destination, on net, for Canadian residents moving within the country. Ontario, meanwhile, has seen the largest net exodus for nearly four straight years.
title: Alberta leads country in interprovincial migration for 3rd straight year

description: Child and Family Service officials raised concerns for years about the way abuse investigations were being conducted by child-welfare agencies, writing in reports that key witnesses were not being interviewed and criminal investigations were put at risk, according to documents obtained by CBC News.
title: Flaws found in Manitoba child-abuse investigations: government documents

description: NordSpace is hoping Thursday is the day it makes history by launching Canada’s first-ever commercial rocket from Newfoundland's Burin Peninsula.
title: NordSpace is making another attempt to launch rocket in N.L.

description: Jimmy Kimmel might be back but worries about free speech and press freedom continue.
title: Jimmy Kimmel, free speech and big money media

description: While many Canadians have had a love-hate relationship with the treat, now that they're nearly gone, what's left appears to be in high demand. And resellers are looking to cash in.
title: $48K for discontinued candy? Cherry Blossom resellers hope to cash in on nostalgia

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney heads to the United Kingdom Thursday to attract investment and strengthen ties that he argues are key to securing Canada's future. The Conservative Party argues Carney is running away from problems at home and has nothing to show for it.
title: Carney heads to U.K. in search of investment and partners — as pressure mounts to show results

description: The dazzling red, orange and yellow jewel tones of autumn that Canadians are used to seeing may be a little muted due to hot, dry conditions across much of the country — but experts say there's still hope that cooler conditions will help trees take their fall fashion cue.
title: Fall feeling a little drab? Mother nature may be missing her environmental cue

description: Single-use plastic items are a substantial contributor to litter across Canada, but compostable alternatives can follow a similar path. Marketplace set out to determine how items would break down if they ended up in our environment.
title: Here's what happens when 'compostable' products become litter

description: After her parents’ divorce, Melanie Chambers thought marriage was a raw deal for women. Then, she met someone who helped her realize they could together redefine what marriage looks like.
title: I was dead set against marriage. But on my 50th birthday, I proposed to the love of my life

description: Sixth-graders in middle schools fared worse on Ontario's standardized literacy and numeracy testing than peers who haven't made that switch, according to a recent report, reviving debates on the merits of separating tweens into intermediate schools.
title: Lower test scores for Grade 6 middle schoolers revives debate about how schools are split

description: U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to sign an executive order Thursday to confirm that a long-awaited deal to divest TikTok’s U.S. operations from its Chinese owner ByteDance will meet the requirements set out in a 2024 law. Here’s what we know so far.
title: What is this TikTok deal Trump keeps talking about?
